etymology.interpretation: The term 外卖(外賣) (wàimài) represents the concept of selling food that is meant to be eaten outside the premises of a restaurant or shop. It captures the modern convenience of ordering meals to be enjoyed elsewhere, a practice that has grown increasingly common in urban settings.

examples.chinese: 我今天订了外卖(我今天訂了外賣)。
工作忙碌时(工作忙碌時)，他喜欢点外卖(他喜歡點外賣)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngzuò mánglù shí, tā xǐhuān diǎn wàimài.
examples.english: When work is busy, he likes to order takeout.
